title: Arsenal outcast's agent speaks out on potential AC Milan move
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Arsenal FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The agent of on-loan Arsenal midfielder Mohamed Elneny has claimed that two Serie A clubs were interested in signing the player last January.

Elneny struggled for playing time following the arrival of Unai Emery as manager, featuring largely in the cup competitions.

He was eventually sent to Besiktas on a season-long loan in the summer, but could so nearly have ended up at one of the giants of Italian football.

Alaa Namzy, who represents the 27-year-old, told Time Sport : " Milan and Roma tried to sign the player during the last winter transfer window.

"But the negotiations didn't work then, and he received more than one offer as well."

(Image: Getty Images)

Namzy went on to add that it wasn't just clubs from abroad who expressed an interest in his client.

"Elneny received a lot of offers last summer, led by Leicester City, West Ham United and Valencia, but Besiktas managed to settle the deal with Arsenal," Nazmy said.

The Egyptian midfielder has made three appearances for the Turkish club so far, but Milan are rumoured to be considering making a fresh bid in January.

Yet despite Elneny seemingly having little future at Arsenal, Nazmy feels there is still a chance he could pull on the club's red and white colours again.

(Image: REUTERS)

"I can't talk about the renewal of the Milan negotiations to sign Elneny during the next transfer window," he added.

"Emery didn't ask for [Elneny's] departure from Arsenal because of his performance, but [Elneny] demanded to take a chance to develop his performance and return again.

"It is possible for him to play with Arsenal again and it still remains strong."
description: The midfielder was surplus to requirements under Gunners' boss Unai Emery who is happy to see him move on
